result.execSummary:
The defendant Grant Jiles Eugene Parks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If defendant remains crime free for 1 year, and all fines and court costs are paid in full, case to be expunged. Defendant to petition the Court

Notice of right to seek post conviction relief.  Waiver of right to attorney

Defendant, Grant Jiles Eugene Parks appeared.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreements reached.  Deft enters a plea of no contest to the charge.    Plea questionnaire reviewed. Clerk directed to enter plea. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas & finds guilty.

Court orders
Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
If defendant remains crime free for 1 year, and all fines and court costs are paid in full, case to be expunged. Defendant to petition the Court
Needs to go to the jail to be printed for the booking process.

Defendant, Grant Jiles Eugene Parks appeared.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint read.  Attorney rights advised.  not guilty plea entered Bond set  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.
